Package com.idevicesinc.sweetblue

Class ReconnectFilter.ConnectFailEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.utils.Event
      • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.ReconnectFilter.ConnectFailEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UsesCustomNull
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DeviceReconnectFilter.ConnectFailEvent, ServerReconnectFilter.ConnectFailEvent
    Enclosing interface:
    ReconnectFilter<T extends ReconnectFilter.ConnectFailEvent>
    public abstract static class ReconnectFilter.ConnectFailEvent
extends Event
implements UsesCustomNull
    Abstract base class for structures passed to ReconnectFilter.onConnectFailed(ConnectFailEvent) and ReconnectFilter.onConnectFailed(ConnectFailEvent) to provide more info about how/why a connection failed.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Interval attemptTime_latest()
      How long the last connection attempt took before failing.

      How long it's been since BleDevice.connect() (or overloads) were initially called.

      The failure count so far.
      int gattStatus()
      The gattStatus returned, if applicable, from native callbacks like BluetoothGattCallback.onConnectionStateChange(BluetoothGatt, int, int) or BluetoothGattCallback.onServicesDiscovered(BluetoothGatt, int).

    • Method Detail

      • failureCountSoFar

        public int failureCountSoFar()
        The failure count so far. This will start at 1 and keep incrementing for more failures.

      • attemptTime_latest

        public Interval attemptTime_latest()
        How long the last connection attempt took before failing.

      • attemptTime_total

        public Interval attemptTime_total()
        How long it's been since BleDevice.connect() (or overloads) were initially called.

      • gattStatus

        public int gattStatus()
        The gattStatus returned, if applicable, from native callbacks like BluetoothGattCallback.onConnectionStateChange(BluetoothGatt, int, int) or BluetoothGattCallback.onServicesDiscovered(BluetoothGatt, int). If not applicable, for example if DeviceReconnectFilter.ConnectFailEvent.status() is DeviceReconnectFilter.Status.EXPLICIT_DISCONNECT, then this is set to BleStatuses.GATT_STATUS_NOT_APPLICABLE.

        See ReadWriteListener.ReadWriteEvent.gattStatus() for more information about gatt status codes in general.
        See Also:
        ReadWriteListener.ReadWriteEvent.gattStatus()

      • autoConnectUsage

        public ReconnectFilter.AutoConnectUsage autoConnectUsage()
        Whether autoConnect=true was passed to BluetoothDevice.connectGatt(Context, boolean, android.bluetooth.BluetoothGattCallback). See more discussion at BleNodeConfig.alwaysUseAutoConnect.
